subject: p12185775
Findings: The heart is moderately enlarged. The aorta is mildly calcified and tortuous. The central pulmonary vessels are engorged and hazy, accompanied by patchy interstitial opacities, most dense at the left base. An ET tube terminates 47 cm above the carina. An orogastric tube terminates within the stomach. There is no pneumothorax or large effusion.
Impression: Extensive bilateral patchy pulmonary opacities. In the setting of central vascular congestion, this is most likely severe pulmonary edema, but pneumonia cannot be excluded, particularly at the left base. ET tube terminating 47 cm above the carina. Orogastric tube within the stomach.
